poem:
Beauty Serum, Morning News

Skintellectuals, they call them—  
in mirrored halls,  
with potions of purpose,  
peptides, retinoids, dreams,  
a cascade of claims.  
Yet, life unfolds  
in simpler strokes—  
a face washed by dawn,  
echoing truths  
beyond ephemeral jars.  
What is beauty,  
if not this moment  
adorned  
with the sheen  
of sincerity?
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Beauty serums are fast, no-nonsense – and do three jobs in one | Sali Hughes on beauty The beauty industry’s great fallacy is that its customer base is made up of (cue nauseating marketing portmanteau) “skintellectuals” – people who have the time, interest and wherewithal to understand the difference between a peptide, a retinoid and a humectant – and the inclination to apply all three in a single routine. In reality, most people do not". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
